name: Dinner Tonight: Curried Celeriac Soup
description: "You've made ugliness beautiful" is Mark Bittman's promise for this recipe. And he's right: the gnarly, knobby look of celeriac (a.k.a. celery root) is pretty unconvincing when you first see it at the market. But inside is the smooth white flesh that can become a luxurious soup.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 pounds celery root, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks
1 cup milk, half and half, or cream, or to taste
1/4 cup cilantro or parsley for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the butter in a large saucepan or other heavy pot over medium heat until foaming, then add the onion. Saute for a minute until it begins to soften, then add the garlic and continue cooking until the onion is soft, 3-5 minutes more. Add the curry powder, cumin, and a pinch of salt and pepper and stir well into the onions. Cook until the flavors marry and the spices are fragrant but not burned, about one minute more.
Add the celery root and stock and bring the mixture to a boil, then simmer until the celery root is tender, 15-20 minutes.

After cooling the mixture slightly, transfer to a blender (or use an immersion blender) and puree until smooth. Return soup to the pot and stir in milk, half and half, or cream, to taste. Season with salt and pepper if necessary. Serve garnished with cilantro or parsley.
